12:20.race_name: TDJ Williams Waste Limited Mares' Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Beat a next-time-out winner on seasonal debut and has another big role to play here
runners.name: Anariza
runners.spotlight: Well beaten when upped to Listed grade at Cheltenham last April (raced too freely) but settled much better in a first-time hood and beat a next-time-out winner on reappearance outing at Wetherby (2m, soft) in November; open to further progress, and a likely contender here.

runners.comment: Delivered on Irish promise when too good for 1-6 favourite on British debut; big player
runners.name: Lau And Shaz
runners.spotlight: Displayed significant promise in bumpers and on all three hurdling starts in Ireland, and kept on too strongly for 1-6 favourite when scoring on British debut at Wincanton (1m7f, good to soft) on Boxing Day; the value of that form is quite tricky to weigh up but, nevertheless, she's of strong interest here.

runners.comment: Promising in bumpers last season and was running well before falling in latest hurdle race
runners.name: Getawhisky
runners.spotlight: Looked promising in bumpers last season (made the frame in a Listed race); just a respectable fourth on hurdle debut at Worcester (2m, good) in October but, under a much more positive ride, had the short-odds favourite out of his comfort zone before falling three out at Ascot (1m7f, good) in November; could still have significant potential.

runners.comment: Showed promise in two good-quality Newbury contests in November; can improve
runners.name: Hornica
runners.spotlight: Hooded for all three starts; close fourth of 18 in good-ground Cheltenham bumper last April and displayed clear promise in two good-quality Newbury hurdles (2m, good to soft/soft) in November; needs to improve here and her tendency to race too freely is a nagging concern but we probably haven't seen the best of her yet.

runners.comment: Did not achieve a huge amount when making the frame on her first two hurdling starts
runners.name: Yasmina
runners.spotlight: Showed some fair Flat form but did not achieve a huge amount when making the frame on her first two hurdling starts (2m/2m1f) and has quite a bit to find here.

runners.comment: Fair Flat-racer; respectable third on recent stable/hurdle debut; needs to build on that
runners.name: Penn Avenue
runners.spotlight: Fair on the Flat at up to 1m4f for Daniel and Claire Kubler (two wins) and a respectable third against own age-group on stable/hurdle debut at Doncaster (2m, good) last month; needs to improve here but that's possible.

12:50.race_name: Royal Windsor Horse Show Cup Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: 2-3 over hurdles, the defeat coming in a Grade 2; this mark might not be beyond him
runners.name: Top Jimmy
runners.spotlight: Won two minor races at Uttoxeter before a credible third to top novice No Drama This End in a Grade 2 at Sandown (2m4f, soft); racing keenly up front ultimately told late on but he remains open to significant improvement and this mark might not be beyond him.

runners.comment: Up 8lb for comfortable handicap debut win but he's clearly on the upgrade
runners.name: Scorpio Rising
runners.spotlight: Only had four runs and won the last two, a maiden at Perth (2m4f, soft) and handicap at Lingfield (2m3f, good to soft; comfortably); 8lb higher now but clearly on the upgrade and commands considerable respect.

runners.comment: Ran quite well at Cheltenham given he carried a penalty against older horses
runners.name: Lisbane Park
runners.spotlight: Bought for £110,000 after his second in an Irish point; won well at Exeter and didn't run too badly at Cheltenham (2m1f; good to soft) given he carried a penalty against older horses (that race was won by the exciting Old Park Star); stepping up in trip for this handicap debut should be a good thing; another with each-way claims.

runners.comment: Beaten under a penalty at Market Rasen but the winner's useful; handicap debut
runners.name: Harry Lowes
runners.spotlight: Winning pointer; beaten under a penalty at Market Rasen (2m4f, good to soft) but the winner has since run quite well in a Grade 1 at Newbury and this 5yo has room for improvement in his jumping; has to be of interest on this handicap debut.

runners.comment: May have got himself too high in the weights and good ground seems his preference
runners.name: Sixty Plus
runners.spotlight: Four wins from the front since joining James Owen and the visor has helped; however, may have got himself too high in the weights now and good ground seems his preference.

runners.comment: Won his maiden at 2m4f and didn't appear to stay the extended 2m7f on handicap debut
runners.name: Fresh Kicks
runners.spotlight: Bumped into a good one on his hurdling debut and then easily justified short odds at Plumpton (2m4f, soft); beaten 18l on his handicap debut at Ascot but he travelled with purpose for much of that race and didn't see out the extended 2m7f; this trip might be the right fit at this stage of his career; respected.

runners.comment: Two promising runs and connections go straight into a handicap for just his third start
runners.name: Fashion Hunter
runners.spotlight: Ran well for an 80-1 chance on debut at Newbury (2m, soft; winner smart) and, although beaten 24l at Fontwell (2m1f, good to soft), the winner looks to have a future; he's not the easiest horse to assess but connections happy to go straight into a handicap for just his third run.

runners.comment: Maiden winner in November; yard won this two years ago with a handicap debutant
runners.name: Maldini Milano
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 6yo who won a bumper and added a maiden over this trip at Plumpton in November (good; first-time cheekpieces); unproven on slow ground but his yard won this two years ago with a handicap debutant; possibilities.

runners.comment: Fifth in a Cheltenham handicap last time and might improve for this step up in distance
runners.name: Kel Du Large
runners.spotlight: Two bumper wins included a Listed race at Cheltenham (heavy) where he wasn't at all disgraced in a good handicap won by the talented Fortune De Mer in December; that was over 2m1f and gives the impression that he'll approve of this stiffer stamina test, especially back on softer ground.

runners.comment: 0-10 in Ireland but showed ability; makes debut for Dan Skelton after wind surgery
runners.name: Tyson
runners.spotlight: 0-10 in Ireland but was runner-up in a big-field handicap last January (2m4f, yielding to soft) and could be interesting now with Dan Skelton, and following wind surgery; Harry Skelton rides the yard's other one and he can do this weight; still needs a market check.

13:20.race_name: LSL Racing Auctions Hampton Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Comfortably bagged Grade 2 honours at Sandown on penultimate start; leading player
runners.name: Salver
runners.spotlight: Very useful over hurdles and comfortably bagged Grade 2 honours at Sandown (3m, good to soft) on second attempt over fences; ran creditably, despite the ground possibly being faster than ideal, in Grade 1 at Kempton since; leading player, provided he takes to first-time headgear.

runners.comment: Record of 7-10 overall and 2-2 since switched to chasing (solid form); respected
runners.name: Wade Out
runners.spotlight: Record of 7-10 overall and 2-2 since switched to chasing (solid form); stayed on well in Listed grade at Cheltenham (3m1f, soft) most recently, proving suited by the first attempt beyond 2m4f under rules; particularly unexposed at this sort of distance and warrants respect.

runners.comment: Not disgraced at Sandown last time but looks held by Salver on that form
runners.name: Doyen Quest
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late N W Lake
runners.spotlight: Has won on soft but seems ideally suited by faster ground; record of 2-5 since switched to chasing includes a Class 2 win at Exeter (3m) on penultimate start; not disgraced at Sandown latest but was beaten 12l by Salver; 5lb pull looks insufficient in the rematch.

runners.comment: Gives the impression he'll shine in handicaps at the big spring festivals
runners.name: Jeriko Du Reponet
runners.spotlight: May still do better over fences but two efforts since returned to this sphere suggest he's one to note for handicap chases at the big spring festivals, in keeping with his hurdles performances last spring, notably a success at Punchestown.

runners.comment: Latest effort (behind two of these rivals) leaves him with something to find
runners.name: Laurens Bay
runners.spotlight: Winner of the EBF Final on last hurdles attempt and followed up, easily beating sole opponent, at Uttoxeter (3m, good) switched to chasing; subsequent effort, behind Salver and Doyen Quest at Sandown, leaves him with something to find.

runners.comment: Ran creditably in his bid for a Doncaster double; had Grade 2 form over hurdles
runners.name: Moon Rocket
runners.spotlight: Runner-up twice at Grade 2 level over hurdles; sound performances at Doncaster (3m, good to soft) switched to chasing this term, comfortably winning a handicap then beaten only half a length by sole rival in follow-up attempt; remains of interest, with further progress still plausible.

13:50.race_name: Fitzdares Extra Places Every Day Great Park Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Useful on his day but two efforts this term suggest he's unlikely to defy top weight
runners.name: Nells Son
runners.spotlight: Veteran who has done most of his winning in Scotland; useful on his day but two efforts this term don't suggest he's going to defy top weight in this field, sent down south.

runners.comment: Not certain to settle with the hood removed but otherwise open to further progress
runners.name: Mirabad
runners.spotlight: Fairly useful form since switched to fences and wearing hood, winning at Exeter then third in Kempton Grade 2; not certain to settle with the headgear removed (has proved headstrong) but otherwise open to further progress in this sphere.

runners.comment: May not revive until winter is out, as he's essentially a spring horse
runners.name: Sans Bruit
runners.spotlight: Hasn't found his form this term and that may well continue until winter is out, as he's essentially a spring horse; gained last five wins in the month of April.

runners.comment: Solid form at Newbury since switched to fences; may well have more to offer in this sphere
runners.name: Mighty Bandit
runners.spotlight: Flat/hurdles winner; solid form at Newbury (2m, good to soft) since switched to fences, finishing a good second (behind subsequent Grade 2 scorer) prior to going one better; may well have more to offer in this sphere and warrants respect.

runners.comment: Remains below last winning mark but continues to carry risk (quirky sort)
runners.name: Harpers Brook
runners.spotlight: Back in better form, albeit wilted a bit late on, at Wetherby last time and remains below last winning mark but continues to carry risk, being a quirky sort.

runners.comment: Gained this season's hurdles win at Windsor; fair 4th over fences at Haydock yesterday
runners.name: Hardy Du Seuil
runners.spotlight: Recorded his chase wins a long time ago but looks interesting given the location, having gained this season's hurdles win at Windsor (2m); however, was just a fair fourth at Haydock on Saturday when returned to fences and this is a higher grade.

runners.comment: Solid record switched to fences this term; may be capable of better still; strong claims
runners.name: Highlands Legacy
runners.spotlight: Solid record (122) switched to fences this term and his penultimate effort has worked out particularly well; ran creditably when favourite at Newbury (2m, good to soft) latest; may be capable of better still; strong contender.

runners.breeder: S A S I E I & Percy Holding Aps
runners.comment: Consistent this season; ties in with Highlands Legacy on latest effort; solid chance
runners.name: Torneo
runners.spotlight: Two wins as a novice chaser last term; consistent this season and his penultimate effort has worked out nicely; ties in with Highlands Legacy on Newbury running last time; solid claims.

runners.comment: Out of form this season; first-time headgear needs to prompt a revival
runners.name: Dr T J Eckleburg
runners.spotlight: Out of form this season and looks far from certain to take advantage of being 5lb below last winning mark, unless first-time headgear prompts a revival.

14:25.race_name: Weatherbys Racing Bank Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.breeder: S C E A Hamel Stud
runners.comment: Gained the last of his Grade 2 wins almost two years ago; generally below form since
runners.name: Botox Has
runners.spotlight: Gained the last of his Grade 2 wins almost two years ago; generally below that form since, most recently returned to handicap level; doesn't look set to end the losing spell.

runners.comment: Switches back to hurdles on return from layoff; 2-4 in this sphere, notably Challow win
runners.name: Captain Teague
runners.spotlight: Absent since finishing lame at Newbury in November 2024, truncating a novice chase campaign; smart previously and has Grade 1 form, including a success in the Challow (2m4f, soft) as a novice hurdler; 2-4 in this sphere; on a workable mark provided he retains ability.

runners.comment: Remains open to further progress; major contender, provided he stays the new trip
runners.name: Ludor
runners.spotlight: Has a solid overall record; fairly useful form switched to handicaps (at about 2m4f on soft) this term, winning by wide margin at Bangor then solid third at Newbury; remains open to further progress; major contender, provided he stays this new trip.

runners.comment: Disappointing last time; consistent sort otherwise and may rebound
runners.name: Long Draw
runners.spotlight: Disappointing last time in a Cheltenham contest that he'd won 12 months earlier; consistent sort otherwise and may rebound; possibly not much in hand off current mark but Lewis Saunders claims a handy 5lb.

runners.comment: Largely progressive; won going away in Pertemps qualifier at Carlisle most recently
runners.name: Nab Wood
runners.spotlight: Largely progressive northern raider; won going away in Pertemps qualifier at Carlisle (3m1f, soft) most recently, taking record this term to 2-3 and overall strike-rate to 4-12; ventures south with respectable claims.

runners.comment: Achieved nothing on return from long absence last time
runners.name: Green Book
runners.owner: Lady Price C Shaw C Boylan & I Tagg
runners.spotlight: Well treated on best form; seemed to need the outing on return from long absence last time but eventually achieved nothing and needs to prove he retains peak ability.

runners.comment: Clear second upped to 2m7f at Chepstow last time; may well improve further; big player
runners.name: Royal Rambler
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 6yo who scored over 2m3f as a novice last term; took his form to a new level with clear second at Chepstow most recently, proving suited by the step up to 2m7f; particularly unexposed at this sort of distance and may well improve further; big player.

runners.comment: Bad early mistake cost him over fences last time; gained only win in May 2023
runners.name: Doughmore Bay
runners.spotlight: Hinted at retaining ability in C&D event on return from lengthy layoff but this is a stronger race; lost chance with bad early mistake switched to fences since; gained only win in May 2023.

runners.comment: Remains in form but is held by Royal Rambler on latest effort
runners.name: Keable
runners.spotlight: Good strike-rate (3-5) in 2025; creditable third at Chepstow (2m7f) last time and remains in form but is held by Royal Rambler on that effort and has perhaps reached his ceiling after climbing the weights.

runners.comment: Well held in three starts since the 2023-24 campaign
runners.name: Lord Snootie
runners.spotlight: Well held in three starts since the 2023-24 campaign, absent for 14 months before latest; nicely treated on best form but probably best watched unless the market speaks positively.

runners.comment: Beaten off current mark in last three outings but Harry Atkins takes off a handy 7lb
runners.name: Tranquil Sea
runners.spotlight: Won at Chepstow (2m7f) on second start for new stable; beaten off current mark in three outings since but penultimate effort (behind progressive rival) reads well; Harry Atkins takes off a handy 7lb.

runners.comment: Latest defeat took handicap record to 0-8; yet to repeat the form of his Grade 2 win
runners.name: Minella Missile
runners.spotlight: Not entirely disgraced but ultimately failed to improve for cheekpieces at Windsor (2m4f) last time, taking handicap record to 0-8; yet to repeat the form of his Grade 2 win in 2023.

runners.breeder: H Lair J Lair & F Champion
runners.comment: Solid effort since joining new stable and switched to handicaps; in the mix
runners.name: Kap Boy
runners.spotlight: Solid record (over 2m4f/2m5f) since joining new stable and switched to handicaps, winning at Perth then placed at Cheltenham and Kempton; has given the impression this new trip is worth exploring; in the mix.

runners.comment: Returns to hurdles with a doubt over current form
runners.name: Go To War
runners.spotlight: Two chase efforts this season leave a doubt over his current form; disappointing in last hurdles attempt so there are enough reasons to oppose him in this competitive race.

runners.comment: Won at Chepstow in December and ran creditably at Cheltenham since; in-form mare
runners.name: Love Of Neymore
runners.spotlight: Record of 3-10 over hurdles, the most recent success at Chepstow (2m7f, good to soft) in December; creditable third at Cheltenham (3m, good) on New Year's Day; this in-form mare is not dismissed.

runners.comment: 3lb higher than when midfield in this race last year
runners.name: Spike Jones
runners.spotlight: Fell in the early stages at Cheltenham last time; couple of good efforts otherwise this term but is more exposed than some of these rivals and 3lb higher than when midfield in this race 12 months ago.

15:00.race_name: Fitzdares Fleur de Lys Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Grade 1 novice chase winner last February; not at same level this term but has had wind op
runners.name: Handstands
runners.spotlight: Concedes weight all round and he hasn't been able to recapture last season's abundant novice chase promise on his two outings this season; however, he's had wind surgery since last time, which may have helped, and he could be a contender if rediscovering the form shown when winning the Grade 1 Scilly Isles Novices' Chase at Sandown last February (2m4f, heavy; made all).

runners.comment: Won handicap over Cheltenham's stiff, extended 2m4f on New Year's Day; entitled to respect
runners.name: Matata
runners.spotlight: Confined to about 2m for the vast majority of his rules career but he won a 3m point in 2022 and looked better than ever when winning a competitive handicap over an extended 2m4f at stiff Cheltenham on New Year's Day (good; versatile ground-wise); there's every chance today's distance will be within range and he won on this card 12 months ago; entitled to respect.

runners.comment: Has won some nice prizes but soundly beaten in Coral Gold Cup and has something to find
runners.name: Resplendent Grey
runners.spotlight: Won the bet365 Gold Cup at Sandown (3m4f, good) last April and reappeared with Listed Intermediate win at Carlisle (2m4f, good to soft); also effective on soft ground; however, soundly beaten in the Coral Gold Cup at Newbury (3m2f, good to soft) last time and has something to find today.

runners.comment: Won veterans' chase at Cheltenham in November but looks vulnerable in today's company
runners.name: Eldorado Allen
runners.spotlight: Three-time Grade 2 chase winner who snapped long losing sequence to land veterans' handicap at Cheltenham (2m4f, soft) in November; ran okay when third next time; however, this 12yo looks vulnerable in today's company.

runners.comment: Lightly raced 12yo; pulled up on stable debut, then pulled up at Ascot yesterday
runners.name: Jungle Boogie
runners.spotlight: 12yo who is very lightly raced for his age and made it five wins from first seven starts when landing good-quality graduation chase at Ascot in December 2024; however, he was well beaten on stable debut at Cheltenham on New Year's Day then pulled up after three out at Ascot yesterday.

runners.comment: Bolted up in this race last year and positive performance on reappearance in November
runners.name: Protektorat
runners.owner: Sir A Ferguson G Mason L Hales The Late J Hales
runners.spotlight: Bolted up in this race last year (soft); reappeared with very creditable third off a lofty mark in handicap at Cheltenham (3m3f, soft) in November; wind surgery since; this 11yo holds stand-out claims on today's terms.

15:35.race_name: Fitzdares Personal Betting Service Stayers Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: 7yo; has improved for switch to fences this term; this trip is well worth a go; respected
runners.name: Holokea
runners.spotlight: 7yo who has improved for the switch to fences this season, winning at Ffos Las (3m1f, soft) in October and finishing second at Uttoxeter (3m2f, soft) and Cheltenham (3m1f, good to soft) on his last two starts, rallying when challenged last time; this trip is well worth a go and he's respected.

runners.comment: Has won at 3m6f and kept on for third over 2m4f here recently; could be a contender
runners.name: Yes Day
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent but won over 3m6f at Exeter (good to firm) last March and kept on for third of seven over 2m4f here (good) on New Year's Day; effective on testing ground earlier in career; may be a contender now back up in trip.

runners.breeder: Mme M Hanquiez Mr G Hanquiez & Earl L
runners.comment: Close second of four when upped to 3m4f at Haydock and he could play a leading role
runners.name: Jupiter Des Bordes
runners.spotlight: Off the mark over fences at the seventh attempt at Warwick (soft) last month on his second crack at 3m, and he's since been a close second of four at Haydock (3m4f, good to soft); this 7yo remains unexposed over this sort of trip and could play a leading role.

runners.breeder: S C E A Ecurie La Grugerie Et Al
runners.comment: Dramatic turnaround when 18-1 winner at Wetherby; stamina to prove but not discounted
runners.name: Hudson De Grugy
runners.spotlight: With this visor back on he left his first two runs for this yard miles behind to win at 18-1 at Wetherby (3m, soft) last month; weakened when upped to 3m5f last January and needs to prove his stamina, but he remains well handicapped on his old form and is not discounted.

runners.comment: Close 3rd over 3m6f at Exeter last February & returned to form when 3rd at Haydock latest
runners.name: Jacks Parrot
runners.spotlight: Close third at Exeter (3m6f, heavy) last February and he returned to form when back over fences at Haydock (3m1f, soft) four weeks ago, finishing third; has the credentials to be in the mix now back up in trip.

runners.comment: 3rd in Borders National at Kelso and this lightly raced 9yo could still have more to offer
runners.name: De Legislator
runners.spotlight: Won at Wetherby (3m, soft) last February on second chase start and belatedly followed up at Ayr (3m, soft) in November; looked to have stamina in abundance when third in the Borders National at Kelso (4m, soft) last month and this lightly raced 9yo could still have more to offer.

runners.comment: Two wins this season, easily last time, but they've both been in small fields at Fakenham
runners.name: Enjoy dAllen
runners.spotlight: 12yo who was very useful in his prime and, having tumbled down the weights, has won twice this season; easily made all under Lily Jones at Fakenham (3m5f, soft) last month and a 5lb rise isn't harsh, but his other win this term also came in a small field there and he's in a tougher race today.

runners.comment: Underwhelming this term but on a handy mark if rediscovering last season's promise
runners.name: Latenightrumble
runners.spotlight: Underwhelming on both starts this season, most recently with these cheekpieces applied at Haydock (3m1f, soft), and he's unraced beyond 3m2f; however, this former pointer was progressive last term when switched to handicap chases and has potential off this mark if rediscovering that promise.

runners.comment: Front-runner who is on last winning mark; not running badly this season but needs extra
runners.name: Rockinastorm
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who won two in a row in late 2024 (3m1f/3m, good/soft), on the second occasion off today's mark, and he ran pretty well over 3m4f at Haydock last March; hasn't run badly on either outing this season but needs something extra this afternoon.

runners.comment: Lacks a recent run but not ruled out for a yard that has won two of the last six runnings
runners.name: Havaila
runners.spotlight: Won at Lingfield (2m7f, heavy) last January and at Plumpton (3m1f, good) in March, and runner-up on last two starts in the spring; lacks a recent outing and is untested at the trip, but he's not ruled out for a stable that has won two of the last six runnings.

runners.comment: Consistent 10yo who won over 3m2f last June but probably needs a career-best today
runners.name: Morfee
runners.spotlight: Won at Fontwell (3m2f, good) last June and is also effective on soft ground; returned from break with encouraging third of five at Plumpton (3m1f, good to soft) last month; however, this 10yo didn't quite see out an extended 3m4f at Plumpton last February (soft) and probably needs a career-best today.

runners.breeder: S C E A Elevage De Clermont
runners.comment: 4th in Borders National where she'd have been closer but for late mistakes; not ruled out
runners.name: Gold Clermont
runners.spotlight: Won over 3m5f/3m3f in winter 2023-24 and has run well on both starts for this yard, most recently 9l fourth in the Borders National at Kelso (4m, soft) where she'd have been closer but for late mistakes; not ruled out.

runners.comment: Runner-up three times in a row then jumping held him back at Kelso; cheekpieces could help
runners.name: Neo King
runners.spotlight: 0-9 under rules (0-6 over fences) but runner-up three times in a row (3m3f-3m6f, various ground) before beaten about 10l when sixth of 11 in the Borders National at Kelso (4m, soft), where his jumping help him back; it's possible he'll find greater fluency today in first-time cheekpieces; chance.

runners.comment: Galloped on relentlessly for two 3m wins last month; the step up in trip may suit this 7yo
runners.name: Express Surprise
runners.spotlight: 3-6 over fences following wins at Wetherby (3m, soft) and Uttoxeter (3m, good to soft) on last two starts; galloped on relentlessly for each of those recent wins and the step up in trip may suit this progressive 7yo.

runners.comment: 2-2 over fences and for Sam Thomas and could take a 5lb rise in his stride
runners.name: Special John
runners.spotlight: Point winner who showed improved form to win on stable/chase debut at Exeter (3m, good to soft) in November and followed up at Wincanton (extended 3m2f, good to soft); takes a steep rise in grade today and he's unproven on soft ground, but he kept on strongly last time and, if conditions suit, may be able to take a 5lb rise in his stride now up in trip.

runners.breeder: Miss Sally Harler & Mr Matthew Darling
runners.comment: Consistent sort who stays well but suspicion today's company may prove too hot
runners.name: Gingerbred
runners.spotlight: Won at Ffos Las (3m, heavy) in February 2024 and has run well in defeat a lot more often than not across his seven starts since, including over 3m4f; however, there's a suspicion today's company may prove too hot.

runners.comment: Won this in 2025 off 7lb higher; step back in right direction over inadequate 2m4f latest
runners.name: Planned Paradise
runners.spotlight: His form went the wrong way after winning this last year (soft) but Ludlow last time was a step back in the right direction, when third over inadequate 2m4f; now 7lb lower than 12 months ago and could have big part to play back up in trip; cheekpieces return (mixed results in them previously).

16:05.race_name: Dave Marley RIP You Legend Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)

runners.breeder: S Gesbert J Lacouture & C Moreau
runners.comment: 2-2 under rules, latest win in Listed grade at Ascot; useful sort who commands respect
runners.name: Bass Hunter
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the third attempt in Irish points; 2-2 under rules, making all at Newbury (by 8l impressively) and Ascot (value for more than the 1l winning margin in soft-ground Listed event); useful sort who commands respect despite conceding weight all round.

runners.comment: Justified favouritism at Taunton on the switch to rules; form franked by runner-up since
runners.name: Cantys Cove
runners.spotlight: Raced twice in Irish points, better effort when second of two finishers on debut; justified favouritism at Taunton (good to firm) on the switch to rules and the runner-up has franked the form by easily going one better since; open to progress.

runners.comment: Emulated siblings by winning on debut but those relatives failed to follow up next time
runners.name: Old Clayesmorian
runners.spotlight: Made the perfect start to his career in Warwick contest (good to soft) by emulating his three siblings who all scored first time out, for his connections; none of them followed up next time, however, so this one needs to prove he can buck the trend.

runners.breeder: Earl Haras Du Luy & Andre Duboe
runners.comment: Shaped promisingly with running-on fourth of 11 at Southwell
runners.name: Eustace Grenier
runners.spotlight: Shaped promisingly with running-on fourth of 11 at Southwell (soft) and is open to improvement with the experience under his belt, albeit faces a stiffer assignment in this field.

runners.breeder: J R Hales & Miss L J Hales
runners.comment: £1,000 4yo; attractively bred but he is the sole newcomer in the field
runners.name: Lil Fortune
runners.spotlight: £1,000 4yo; half-brother to three winners, notably Tedham (useful 2m5f hurdle/3m chase); dam bumper/useful 2m-2m3f hurdle scorer; attractively bred but he is the sole newcomer in the field.

runners.comment: Had wind surgery since finishing fourth to Old Clayesmorian at Warwick; may improve
runners.name: Sassella Storm
runners.owner: The One We Came For Partnership
runners.spotlight: Eventually faded into fourth, nonetheless showing some promise, in the Warwick event won by Old Clayesmorian; had wind surgery since and may be capable of better, which is admittedly required.

runners.comment: Solid fourth at Chepstow where a couple of subsequent winners filled the first two places
runners.name: St Jamess Finest
runners.spotlight: Finished a solid fourth at Chepstow (soft) where a couple of subsequent winners filled the first two places; takes on some useful sorts in this field but could go well if normal progress materialises.

runners.comment: Stepped up on debut 4th when strong-finishing 2nd in Listed Ascot race since; can go well
runners.name: Tally Ho Back
runners.spotlight: Some promise on Newton Abbot debut in October and he belied his 40-1 odds with strong-finishing second, clear of remainder, in Listed grade at Ascot (soft) last month; should be open to further improvement and likely to go well.

runners.comment: Overcame greenness to make a winning debut in Listed race at Huntingdon; promising mare
runners.name: Timamzel
runners.spotlight: Looks a particularly promising mare, having overcome greenness to make a winning debut in Listed grade against her own sex at Huntingdon (soft) in December; incurs a penalty but still receives weight all round in taking on males; major contender.

12:30.race_name: Racing TV Conditional Jockeys' Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Competitive off even higher marks but has to bounce back from two below-par efforts
runners.name: Belcamo
runners.spotlight: Flat winner but 0-11 as a hurdler and can race freely; has shown he can be competitive off even higher marks but has to bounce back from two below-par efforts.

runners.comment: Placed in a Class 4 last time at Wincanton so a likely contender at this level
runners.name: Castle Quarter
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs R Newiss & Gavin Teversham
runners.spotlight: Four-time AW winner and added a Uttoxeter handicap last May (2m, good); placed in a Class 4 last time at Wincanton (good to soft) so a likely contender at this level; tongue-tie is added.

runners.comment: Has some solid races in handicaps, including on her last four appearances
runners.name: Lusso Milan
runners.spotlight: Longstanding maiden but has run some solid races in handicaps, including on her last four appearances (new yard on last two starts); handicap mark hasn't really gone anywhere so looks sure to be heavily involved.

runners.comment: Handicap newcomer but positives fairly thin on the ground after six starts
runners.name: Lord Of The Glance
runners.spotlight: Positives fairly thin on the ground after six starts (tried a tongue-tie last time) and goes handicapping with an awful lot to prove.

runners.breeder: S C E A Le Haras DHaspel
runners.comment: Had a break since her last run which was too bad to be true; may need further
runners.name: Path Of Stars
runners.spotlight: Now 0-11 but has made the frame in handicaps and had a break since her last run which was too bad to be true; however, she may need further and drier ground.

runners.comment: Again below his former best but he still won at Huntingdon; 4lb rise no big deal
runners.name: Lelantos
runners.spotlight: Again below his former best but he still won at Huntingdon (3m1f, good to soft) two months ago and a 4lb rise is no big deal; clear claims.

runners.comment: Heavy ground perhaps not ideal on last two starts but now looks high in the weights
runners.name: Getaway With You
runners.spotlight: Winning run came to an end when no match for a front-runner at Uttoxeter (2m4f) and his third at Ffos Las was remote (2m); both those runs were on heavy and this ground should be more suitable, but now looks high in the weights.

runners.comment: First and second since the cheekpieces went on and he should have more to offer
runners.name: Castanea Breeze
runners.spotlight: Fair form in bumpers so no great surprise to see him win a handicap at Market Rasen in December (2m7f, good to soft) and backed that up with a second of 16 at Wetherby; up another 3lb but the cheekpieces are working well and he should have more to offer.

runners.comment: Struggling for form when last seen and has been off since early September
runners.name: Jack The Savage
runners.owner: M White J Frampton L Horsfall
runners.spotlight: Potentially well handicapped but was struggling for form when last seen and has been off since early September.

runners.comment: Catterick was disappointing but a 3m winner the time before and could bounce back
runners.name: Apieceovfortune
runners.spotlight: Only her second run in handicaps when collecting at Southwell (3m) but Catterick was a bit disappointing; could bounce back.

13:30.race_name: Book Your Skip Online @ fakenhamskips.co.uk Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Point and dual bumper winner; every chance of making a winning start over hurdles
runners.name: Clay Pigeons
runners.owner: Aisling Byrne & Paul Raleigh & Matthew Cunningham
runners.spotlight: Joined Willie Mullins for 95,000euros after winning a 3m point and 2m3f bumper at Cork; wasn't overly troubled to defy a penalty on yard debut at Catterick (good to soft; first-time tongue-tie) and he posted a useful RPR in the process; every chance of making a winning start over hurdles.

runners.comment: No closer than 22l in his four bumpers and tailed off in Listed events on last two starts
runners.name: Kampari
runners.spotlight: No closer than 22l in his four bumpers and tailed off in Listed events on last two starts; makes no real appeal.

runners.comment: Placed in both his maiden hurdles when trained in Ireland; bought for £54,000
runners.name: King Jon Oliver
runners.spotlight: Had three runs in Ireland prior to £54,000 sale, running no race in a bumper but placed in two maiden hurdles (2m/2m3f); clearly up to winning a race of this nature and Olly Murphy should get some improvement out of him.

runners.comment: Quiet in two bumpers and same again on recent stable/hurdle debut at this venue
runners.name: Lawsky
runners.spotlight: Showed nothing in two bumpers for Paul Webber and a similar tale on stable/hurdle debut here last month, despite being only 7-2; lots to prove.

runners.comment: James Owen has yet to find the key to him and he was beaten off a modest mark last time
runners.name: Oneinthewell
runners.spotlight: All downhill since winning a Leopardstown bumper on his debut in March of last year; James Owen has yet to find the key to him and he was beaten off a modest mark last time.

runners.comment: Only 1-14 in points; 100-1 when refusing to race in a Wetherby maiden on Boxing Day
runners.name: Callmesusie
runners.spotlight: Only 1-14 in points; 100-1 when refusing to race in a Wetherby maiden on Boxing Day.

runners.comment: Dual bumper winner and finished third in a small field on hurdle debut at Plumpton
runners.name: Masked Mistress
runners.spotlight: Two bumper wins on good ground and made a respectable start over hurdles when third in a small field at Plumpton (2m4f); highly likely that she'll need more here, however.

14:05.race_name: Fakenham Skips Mares' Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Mares' Hurdle Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: Won this in 2025 but needs to be perked up by a change of headgear today
runners.name: Mermaids Cave
runners.spotlight: Comfortably won Huntingdon claimer (2m, good) in November, after a break, but well beaten in two subsequent handicaps (albeit better ones than this); still 13lb higher than when winning this race a year ago; needs change of headgear to perk her up.

runners.comment: Will appreciate this ease in grade but has not really fired on either outing this season
runners.name: Pretending
runners.spotlight: Won valuable final of this series at Cheltenham (2m4f, good) in spring 2024 and was third in last year's edition but has not really fired on either start this season; eased in grade today but needs to up her game.

runners.breeder: A Hales Mr & Mrs J Fry Mr D Fitzgerald
runners.comment: Slightly disappointing at Windsor this month but began this season with two good efforts
runners.name: Looking As You Are
runners.spotlight: Three-time hurdle winner, most recently off 2lb lower at Ludlow (2m5f, good to soft) last February; slightly disappointing when fifth at Windsor this month but began this season with two good efforts and has a fighting chance.

runners.comment: Safely held on seasonal/stable debut but will probably come good for Dan Skelton soon
runners.name: Miss Cynthia
runners.spotlight: Very useful on the Flat in 2024 and made winning handicap hurdle debut for Lucy Wadham at Market Rasen (2m4f, good to soft) last February before finishing second in a Listed race; safely held on seasonal/stable debut at Kempton just after Christmas but will probably come good for Dan Skelton soon.

runners.comment: Aided by cheekpieces when ending 2025 with two good runs; probably won't be far away
runners.name: Audacious Annie
runners.spotlight: Seemingly aided by first-time cheekpieces when clear second at Warwick (2m5f, good to soft) in November and ran well for a long way before fading into fifth at Kempton (3m, good) just after Christmas; this drop back in trip looks the right move; probably won't be far away.

runners.comment: Held on well at Wincanton last mnonth and is now 4-6 in handicaps; respected
runners.name: Apples Moon
runners.spotlight: Progressive 7yo who held on well to score at Wincanton (2m4f, soft) last month and is now 4-6 in handicaps; latest 5lb rise does not look excessive and it's hard to tell when her improvement will level off; respected.

runners.comment: Displayed rapid improvement in November, winning twice (2m/2m5f); up in grade today
runners.name: Princess Keri
runners.spotlight: Displayed rapid improvement in the autumn, winning in good style at Lingfield (2m, good to soft) and Ludlow (2m5f, good); moves up in grade here but Ned Fox claims a useful 5lb and she may still have more to offer.

14:40.race_name: Gamble Plant (Norfolk) Ltd Queen Boudicca Series Final Mares' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: In good form when last seen last spring and has a C&D win on her CV; big player
runners.name: Sainte Doctor
runners.spotlight: Five-time chase winner (good/good to soft; once over C&D); absent since very respectable third at Aintree (2m4f, good) last May but this race is easier and she features prominently in calculations.

runners.comment: Wide-margin winner of two-finisher C&D contest last month; went back up 7lb for that
runners.name: Gazette Bourgeoise
runners.spotlight: Not the force of old but exploited favourable mark when beating Jacks Touch by 21l in two-finisher C&D (soft) contest last month, her second C&D success; also suited by much faster ground but has gone back up 7lb.

runners.comment: Made audacious bid from the front in big-field Cheltenham handicap last month; considered
runners.name: Its Easy
runners.spotlight: Doubled chasing tally with huge-margin success in four-runner contest at Bangor (2m4f, heavy) in November and made audacious bid from the front before weakening into eighth in big field at Cheltenham (2m4f, good to soft) last month; didn't run particularly well on her previous visit to Fakenham but could take some catching if she gets into a good rhythm.

runners.comment: 0-10 in first half of 2025 and both recent rules runs were underwhelming; revival needed
runners.name: Jacks Touch
runners.spotlight: Triple chase winner in 2023-24 season (once over C&D); 0-10 in points in first half of 2025 and returned to racing under rules with two underwhelming runs towards end of last year, latterly when remote second to Gazette Bourgeoise here last month; revival needed.

runners.comment: Absent since Huntingdon win last April but could still have potential over fences
runners.name: Overabottleofred
runners.spotlight: Left clear at final fence to win by 21l at Huntingdon (2m7f, good) last April, her third chasing start; has fitness to prove after nine-month absence but could still have potential.

runners.comment: Second in this race in 2025 but out of form over fences and hurdles this season.
runners.name: Moviddy
runners.owner: Noel Fehily Racing Syndicate & Miss J Wignall
runners.spotlight: Creditable second to smart rival in this race a year ago and won small-field Wincanton chase (3m1f, also good) last March; out of form over fences and hurdles this season, though, and needs to turn a corner; tongue-tie/cheekpieces refitted.

runners.comment: Second over C&D in October but well held twice since and 5lb wrong today
runners.name: Gata Ban
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner; kept on for second over C&D (good to soft) on seasonal/chase debut in October but two disappointing runs have followed (cheekpieces added last time) and she's 5lb wrong today.

runners.comment: Won three-runner race here in October but has very mixed record this season
runners.name: Belle Montrose
runners.spotlight: Readily won three-runner race here (2m, good) in October, her second success this season, but has very mixed record in recent months; competes from 6lb out of the weights today and is untested beyond 2m3f under rules; others have stronger claims.

15:10.race_name: Wensum Farmers: Making Progress & Working Together Handicap Chase

runners.comment: 0-5 over fences and absent since his well-held fourth at Bangor last March
runners.name: As Tears Go By
runners.owner: Mark E Smith And David Lestrange
runners.spotlight: Regressive 8yo who is 0-5 over fences and has been absent since his well-held fourth at Bangor (2m1f, good) last March; might have been refreshed by a layoff but could be considered only if lively in the betting.

runners.comment: Scored at Southwell last month; still on workable mark if in right mood again
runners.name: Flash In The Park
runners.owner: Mt Hughes John Lawson Stephanie Kaye
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent for this stable last year but cashed in on a reduced mark at Southwell (2m, good to soft) in early December; will be fine over today's longer trip and subsequent 5lb rise is manageable if he's in the right mood again.

runners.breeder: S A Richards & Mrs L Kemble
runners.comment: Off since disappointing run last April but well handicapped on C&D second in early 2025
runners.name: Brother Boris
runners.owner: Elb Bloodstock Ltd And R L Banks
runners.spotlight: Ten-race maiden who disappointed when among the market principals at Warwick (2m, good) last April and has not raced since; came second over C&D (good to soft) at start of last year, though, and is now 7lb lower.

runners.breeder: J DArgentre G DArtentre Et Al
runners.comment: Course winner over hurdles; no surprise if he bounces back to form today
runners.name: Crac De Megaudais
runners.spotlight: Scored by 12l over hurdles here (2m4f, good) at start of 2025 and subsequently ran well on chasing debut at Newton Abbot (2m, good); returned from break with two heavy defeats towards end of last year but travelled well for a long way on first occasion and had an excuse last time (bled); might bounce back on return to this track.

runners.comment: Won twice at Plumpton last season but has lost her way since last spring
runners.name: Miss Fedora
runners.spotlight: Dual chase winner from off the pace at Plumpton last season (2m1f, soft/good) but has lost her way since last spring, and cheekpieces (retained) didn't appear to help much at Lingfield last month; leap of faith required to support her here.

runners.comment: Very inconsistent, but won over C&D last May and was second over hurdles here last month
runners.name: Annie Nail
runners.spotlight: Won C&D mares' chase (good ground) last spring and returned to form with 66-1 second over hurdles here (2m7f, soft) last month; far too inconsistent to rely upon but at least we know she's very well suited by this track.

runners.comment: Safely held in both handicap hurdles but may improve on this chasing debut
runners.name: Little Wren
runners.spotlight: Unable to justify prominence in the betting when safely held in two handicap hurdles (2m4f/3m) towards end of last year but remains unexposed after only six starts and this switch to fences may prompt the improvement that has evidently been expected; sports first-time cheekpieces.

15:45.race_name: Racing TV Open Maiden National Hunt Flat Race (Category 3 Elimination) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: £3,000 yearling; half-brother to two winners but he may be one for further down the line
runners.name: All Good To Go
runners.spotlight: £3,000 yearling; eighth foal; half-brother to winners Artic Row (2m-2m4f hurdle/chase; RPR 122) and Artic Mann (2m6f/3m2f hurdle; 112); dam 2m/2m1f hurdle/chase winner (130); he may be one for further down the line.

runners.comment: Promise in sole point and could build on his bumper debut fifth if settling better
runners.name: Current Edition
runners.spotlight: Close-up when falling at the final fence in sole point (3m, good to yielding) and last month's bumper debut fifth at Warwick (2m, good to soft) gives him something to build on, especially if settling better.

runners.comment: No match for the winner on debut at Uttoxeter but with a leading yard & likely to improve
runners.name: Eastern Fire
runners.spotlight: No match for the winner when second of four on debut at Uttoxeter (2m, heavy) in November, when a 5-1 chance; however, he's with a leading stable and there can be optimism he'll improve.

runners.breeder: Earl Trinquet O Trinquet & M Trinquet
runners.comment: Point winner who can improve for his bumper debut in November; strong claims
runners.name: Lultimatom
runners.spotlight: Won by 8l on debut in Irish maiden point (3m, yielding) last March and subsequently sold for £225,000; fifth of 14 at 11-4 on bumper debut at Fairyhouse (2m, yielding to soft) in November, when shaping as though he would improve for the run, and he holds strong claims for his top Irish yard.
